title: Valentine proposal single-screen UI with evasive No and meme reveal

requirements.summary: Build a single-screen Valentine prompt with the exact question and exactly two choices (Yes/No).
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the user sees the question "Will you be my Valentine?" and exactly two buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".
The page has no additional primary actions beyond the Yes/No choice.

file_operations.description: Create the single-screen React UI rendering the prompt text and exactly two actions ("Yes" and "No") with a minimal layout. Use the shadcn-ui Button component styling pattern (or equivalent existing shadcn button component if already present) to keep buttons consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a shadcn-ui compatible Button component (if not already present in the project) to support consistent button styling/variants used by the Valentine prompt. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Make the "No" button evasive on hover/touch while staying fully within the viewport.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop browsers, moving the cursor onto the "No" button causes it to relocate immediately.
On touch devices (including iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the "No" button causes it to relocate before a click/tap is registered.
The "No" button never relocates off-screen; it remains fully visible and within the viewport after each move.
The user cannot successfully click/tap the "No" button under normal use because it moves away on interaction.

file_operations.description: Implement a React hook that computes safe random positions for the "No" button within a bounding container/viewport, handling pointer enter and pointer down/touch start so the button moves before a click is registered, and clamping to keep it fully visible on iPad-sized viewports.
Wire the evasive behavior into the "No" button using pointer/touch-safe handlers and container-relative positioning so it relocates immediately and never goes off-screen.

requirements.summary: On "Yes" click, replace the choice UI with a confirmation view showing the meme and the exact text "Good choice".
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "Yes" button hides or disables both buttons and shows a result state.
The result state includes the exact text "Good choice" (English, matching capitalization and spacing).
The result state displays the provided/generated meme image clearly on both desktop and iPad Chrome.

file_operations.description: Add state to switch from the choice UI to a result view on "Yes" click; ensure the result view shows the exact text "Good choice" and renders the static meme image at a responsive size optimized for iPad Chrome.

requirements.summary: Apply a romantic pink-and-white theme with a clean, responsive layout optimized for iPad Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: The dominant colors used are pink and white; the overall styling reads as romantic and minimal.
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad-sized viewports in Chrome (no horizontal scrolling; key content fits on screen).
Animations/transitions (if any) are smooth and do not block interaction.

file_operations.description: Create Tailwind entry CSS and define global theme tokens/styles (pink/white background, romantic typography defaults, smooth transitions) using existing Tailwind/CSS-variable conventions so the UI is minimal and iPad-friendly.
Apply Tailwind utility classes for a centered, responsive layout (no horizontal scrolling) and touch-friendly spacing/sizing; keep animations subtle and non-blocking.

requirements.summary: Add the generated meme image as a frontend static asset and load it directly in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The app references the static asset path directly and it loads in the browser without backend involvement.

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset file at the exact required path for direct static serving by the frontend build.

Reference and render the static image from frontend/public via the exact file path frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png so it loads without any backend involvement.
